comment: Dr. Olovson is one of the best if not the best professor I've had at KSU! I took his Teaching English in East Asia class which was SO much fun. He's caring and is available though both email and his office hours. He helped me with my future plans after graduation and is super invested in his students. He's great at teaching. TAKE HIM!!!

He is great. He responded to emails faster than any professor or teacher I have ever had. What he expects is very clear and that is a huge priority to me because I can't stand professors who are unclear about due dates or assignment requirements etc. I would 100% take any of his classes again.

Dr.Olovson is a great Spanish instructor who wants the best for his students. He wishes to teach his students to be prepared to comprehend and speak Spanish, even outside of class, and his provided learning activities achieve this all together.

Senor Olovson is a great teacher. Even with having him online, he still makes his feedback and relationships with his students personal. I learned a lot this semester without a lot of stress and hard work. Would 100% take him again for other spanish classes in the future.

Senor Olovson is the best professor I have had at this school. He cares so much about his students and wants everyone to succeed. I took three years of Spanish in high school and never got an A. I was very worried about starting Spanish again this year for the first time in 4 years and skipping Spanish 1, but he made the class so easy.

Dr. O is a phenomenal professor. I had him for the 8-week summer session, and if you do the work properly, you will do very well in his course. He responds to emails quickly and is fair to his students. His course is enjoyable and you will learn a lot. Take his class!

Great teacher who clearly knows how to teach Spanish to students. I took 3 years in high school then had 2 years off but coming back to it was really easy with him. He is very friendly/funny and gives great feedback. His workload is not excessive and expectations are always clear. I am sure he is even better in person. Just take him.
I took him in the summer as an extra credit, He's a good teacher and gives good feedback! Always open to help his students.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Participation matters--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Olovson was amazing! I took spanish in high school but it never clicked however when I took him for intro to Spanish I it was awesome. Really great teacher very caring and pretty funny. He knows how to teach and the material stuck. There is a lot of work but it helps you truly understand the material better.

Dr. O is like a young version of Mr. Rogers. He gets really excited about Spanish, and you can tell he really cares about students as people. He made me work hard, but I learned a lot. He also made me laugh almost every class (lots of corny jokes). I recently signed up to be a Spanish minor so I really hope to take him again in the future.

Brian is a great professor for any class or level of Spanish. He really tries to help students and the class is overall very easy if you pay attention. There is a lot of online homework, but it's fairly easy. 10/10 recommend.

Professor Olovson's teaching style is outstanding. He teaches several different styles to help each student better understand the content. He is a shining model for what it means to be a role model and educator. He truly cares to help the students learn. He is flexible but also maintains a high standard.

Dr. Olovson is one of my favorite professors. As long as you do the homework and participate, the tests will be a breeze. And theres extra credit. Hes really funny and extremely nice. 10/10. He has made me want to switch to Foreign Language Education.

One of the best professors at KSU. He is extremely kind and will go out of his way for his students. He's also very funny. He helped guide me for my essays and genuinely always seemed excited to read whatever I would come up with next. Please take him.

Dr. Olovson is hands down the best professor I've had at KSU so far. You can tell that he really cares and wants you to succeed. He does lots of interactive activities so you actually feel like you can use the language stuff you're learning too. Even though I'm required to take a language for my major, I actually looked forward to going to class.
